ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Type of polysomnography assessment
Notes: e.g., Overnight PSG, Multiple Sleep Latency Test (MSLT)

ElementDescription: Total Recording Time (length of polysomnography recording), in seconds
Total Sleep Time, in seconds
Total Sleep Period (time between lights out and lights on), in seconds
Sleep Efficiency (time spent asleep vs time spent in bed) Percentage
Notes: Time spent asleep / Time spent in bed * 100

ElementDescription: Sleep Latency (time it took the participant to fall asleep), in seconds
REM Latency (time between when the participant fell asleep and the onset of the first REM period), in seconds
Wake after Sleep Onset (total amount of time spent awake between time that participant fell asleep and their final awakening), in seconds
Total number of awakenings during sleep period
Total number of arousals during sleep period
Total number of arousals per hour during sleep period
Stage Shifts (number of times the participant moved between sleep phases) during the sleep period
Time spent in sleep stage N1, in seconds
Time spend in sleep stage N2, in seconds
Time spent in sleep stage N3, in seconds
Time spent in REM sleep, in seconds
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Visit number
Stage of sleep the participant is currently in during the PSG recording
The channel delta waves (0.5 - 4 Hertz) are detected in
Notes: Cz = Midline Central; Fz = Midline Frontal

ElementDescription: Delta band power (power or amplitude of brain activity within the delta frequency range)
